result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber N Harvey-Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment plan of $50.00/month commencing on 8-28-2016 and continuing to be due on the 28th of every month until paid in full.

Submit to DNA sample forthwith.
Concurrent with: any WSP sentence currently serving.
Payable to the Clerk of Courts through the court ordered payment plan commencing on 8-28-2016.
